reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It is difficult, if not impossible, to define the limits which reason should impose on the desire for wealth; for there is no absolute or definite amount of wealth which will satisfy a man. The amount is always relative, that is to say, just so much as will maintain the proportion between what he wants and what he gets; for to measure a man's happiness only by what he gets, and not also by what he expects to get, is as pointless as to try and express a fraction which shall have a numerator but no denominator. A man never feels the loss of things which it never occurs to him to ask for; he is just as happy without them; whilst another, who may have a hundred times as much, feels miserable because he has not got the one thing he wants. In fact, every man has a horizon of his own, and he will expect as much as he thinks it is possible for him to get.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 주제로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: the importance of setting financial goals
the relative nature of satisfaction from wealth
the process of overcoming material desires
the social inequality caused by wealth
the difference between reason and emotion

answer.explanation: 이 글은 부에서 오는 만족감은 절대적인 양에 의해 결정되는 것이 아니라, 개인이 원하는 것과 얻는 것 사이의 '비율'에 따라 달라지는 상대적인 것이라고 반복해서 설명하고 있습니다. 따라서 글의 핵심 주제는 '부에서 오는 만족의 상대적 본질'입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 제목으로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: Wealth: A Fraction of Desire and Possession
How to Limit Your Desire for Wealth
The Pointless Nature of Material Gain

answer.explanation: 이 글은 행복을 분수에 비유하며, 얻은 것(분자)뿐만 아니라 원하는 것(분모)에 의해 결정된다고 설명합니다. 이 제목은 글의 핵심 비유인 '분수(fraction)'와 그 구성 요소인 '욕망(desire)'과 '소유(possession)'를 정확히 포착하여 글 전체의 내용을 함축적으로 보여줍니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 요지로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: Defining a specific limit on personal wealth is a necessary step for achieving true happiness in life.
A person's happiness depends not on absolute wealth but on the ratio between desires and possessions.
Society should impose reasonable limits on the accumulation of wealth to ensure fairness for everyone.
It is pointless to measure one's own happiness by comparing it with that of other people around us.
The primary factor in human misery is the constant and unavoidable loss of valuable material things.

answer.explanation: 글의 핵심 내용은 부의 절대적인 양이 아니라, 개인이 원하는 것과 실제 소유한 것 사이의 '비율(proportion/ratio)'이 행복을 결정한다는 것입니다. 'The amount is always relative'와 분수 비유가 이를 뒷받침하므로, '행복은 절대적 부가 아닌 욕망과 소유의 비율에 달려있다'가 이 글의 요지입니다.

( ① ) For to measure a man's happiness only by what he gets, and not also by what he expects to get, is as pointless as to try and express a fraction which shall have a numerator but no denominator. ( ② ) A man never feels the loss of things which it never occurs to him to ask for; he is just as happy without them; ( ③ ) whilst another, who may have a hundred times as much, feels miserable because he has not got the one thing he wants. ( ④ ) In fact, every man has a horizon of his own, and he will expect as much as he thinks it is possible for him to get. ( ⑤ )
reading_comprehension_problems.question:
글의 흐름으로 보아, 주어진 문장이 들어가기에 가장 적절한 곳은?

**The amount is always relative, that is to say, just so much as will maintain the proportion between what he wants and what he gets.**

answer.explanation: 주어진 문장은 부에서 오는 만족감이 '상대적'이며, 원하는 것과 얻는 것의 '비율'에 의해 결정된다고 설명합니다. (①) 앞 문장은 사람을 만족시키는 절대적인 부의 양은 없다고 말합니다. 주어진 문장은 그 이유를 설명하며 '상대성'이라는 핵심 개념을 도입합니다. (①) 뒤의 문장은 'for(~이기 때문에)'로 시작하여 바로 앞 문장의 '비율' 개념을 분수 비유로 부연 설명하므로, 주어진 문장은 (①)에 들어가는 것이 가장 논리적입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It is difficult, if not impossible, to define the limits which reason should impose on the desire for wealth; for there is no absolute or definite amount of wealth which will satisfy a man.

question_blocks.A: A man never feels the loss of things which it never occurs to him to ask for; he is just as happy without them; whilst another, who may have a hundred times as much, feels miserable because he has not got the one thing he wants.
question_blocks.B: The amount is always relative, that is to say, just so much as will maintain the proportion between what he wants and what he gets; for to measure a man's happiness only by what he gets, and not also by what he expects to get, is as pointless as to try and express a fraction which shall have a numerator but no denominator.
question_blocks.C: In fact, every man has a horizon of his own, and he will expect as much as he thinks it is possible for him to get.

reading_comprehension_problems.question: 주어진 글 다음에 이어질 글의 순서로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: 주어진 글은 절대적인 부의 양은 사람을 만족시킬 수 없다고 제시합니다. (B)에서 그 이유로 부의 만족감은 '상대적'이며, 소유와 욕망의 비율이라는 점을 분수 비유로 설명합니다. (A)에서 적게 가졌지만 행복한 사람과 많이 가졌지만 불행한 사람의 예를 들어 (B)의 상대성 원리를 구체화합니다. 마지막으로 (C)에서 'In fact'로 시작하며 앞선 예시를 '자신만의 수평선'이라는 개념으로 일반화하여 결론을 맺습니다. 따라서 (B)-(A)-(C)의 순서가 가장 자연스럽습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: The amount is always relative, that is to say, just so much as will maintain the proportion between what he wants and what he gets; for to measure a man's happiness only by what he gets, and not also by what he expects to get, is as pointless as to try and express a fraction which shall have ____________________. A man never feels the loss of things which it never occurs to him to ask for; he is just as happy without them; whilst another, who may have a hundred times as much, feels miserable because he has not got the one thing he wants.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 빈칸에 들어갈 말로 가장 적절한 것은?

options.text: an integer instead of a ratio

answer.explanation: 빈칸 앞부분에서 행복을 '얻는 것(what he gets)'만으로 측정하는 것은 무의미하다고 말합니다. 글의 비유에 따르면 '얻는 것'은 분수의 분자(numerator)에 해당하고, '기대하는 것(what he expects to get)'은 분모(denominator)에 해당합니다. 따라서 기대치(분모) 없이 얻은 것(분자)만으로 행복을 표현하려는 시도는 '분자는 있지만 분모는 없는' 분수를 표현하려는 것과 같이 무의미합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It is difficult, if not ① [impossible], to define the limits which reason should impose on the desire for wealth; for there is no absolute or ② [definite] amount of wealth which will satisfy a man. The amount is always ③ [relative], that is to say, just so much as will maintain the proportion between what he wants and what he gets; for to measure a man's happiness only by what he gets, and not also by what he expects to get, is as ④ [pointless] as to try and express a fraction. A man never feels the loss of things which it never occurs to him to ask for; he is just as happy without them; whilst another, who may have a hundred times as much, feels ⑤ [contented] because he has not got the one thing he wants.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 밑줄 친 부분 중, 문맥상 낱말의 쓰임이 적절하지 않은 것은?

answer.explanation: 이 문장은 100배나 더 많이 가졌음에도 불구하고 원하는 한 가지를 갖지 못해 느끼는 감정을 묘사합니다. 이는 행복한 상태와는 거리가 멀기 때문에 '만족하는(contented)'은 문맥에 맞지 않습니다. 원문처럼 '비참한(miserable)' 또는 '불행한(unhappy)'과 같은 부정적인 단어가 와야 합니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It is difficult, if not impossible, to define the limits which reason should (A) [impose] on the desire for wealth; for there is no (B) [absolute] or definite amount of wealth which will satisfy a man. The amount is always relative, that is to say, just so much as will maintain the (C) [proportion] between what he wants and what he gets; for to measure a man's happiness only by what he gets, and not also by what he expects to get, is as pointless as to try and express a fraction which shall have a numerator but no (D) [denominator]. In fact, every man has a (E) [horizon] of his own, and he will expect as much as he thinks it is possible for him to get.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 밑줄 친 (A)~(E)에 대한 영영 풀이가 적절하지 않은 것은?

options.text: (A) impose: to establish or apply by authority.
(B) absolute: existing independently and not in relation to other things.
(C) proportion: a statement that two ratios are equal.
(D) denominator: the number below the line in a common fraction.
(E) horizon: the limit of a person's knowledge, experience, or interest.

answer.explanation: (C) proportion은 이 문맥에서 '비율' 또는 '부분 간의 관계(the relationship of one thing to another in size, amount, etc.)'를 의미합니다. '두 비율이 같다는 진술'은 수학에서의 '비례식'을 의미하는 것으로, 이 글의 '원하는 것과 얻는 것 사이의 비율'이라는 의미와는 다릅니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: The amount is always (A) [absolute / relative], that is to say, just so much as will maintain the proportion between what he wants and what he gets; for to measure a man's happiness only by what he gets, and not also by what he expects to get, is as (B) [pointless / meaningful] as to try and express a fraction which shall have a numerator but no denominator. A man never feels the loss of things which it never occurs to him to ask for; he is just as happy without them; whilst another, who may have a hundred times as much, feels (C) [miserable / cheerful] because he has not got the one thing he wants.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 문맥에 맞는 낱말로 가장 적절한 것은?

answer.explanation: (A) 글의 핵심에 따라 부의 만족감은 '상대적(relative)'입니다. (B) 기대치를 고려하지 않고 소유만으로 행복을 측정하는 것은 '무의미(pointless)'합니다. (C) 원하는 것을 갖지 못한 부자는 '비참함(miserable)'을 느낍니다. 따라서 정답은 relative - pointless - miserable 입니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It is difficult, if not impossible, to define the limits which reason should impose on the desire for wealth. ① The amount is always relative, that is to say, just so much as will maintain the proportion between what he wants and what he gets. ② This principle of relativity applies to many other areas of life, not just wealth. ③ To measure a man's happiness only by what he gets, and not also by what he expects to get, is as pointless as to try and express a fraction which shall have a numerator but no denominator. ④ A man never feels the loss of things which it never occurs to him to ask for. ⑤ In fact, every man has a horizon of his own, and he will expect as much as he thinks it is possible for him to get.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글에서 전체 흐름과 관계 없는 문장은?

answer.explanation: 이 글은 '부에 대한 욕망'과 그로 인한 만족감의 상대성에 초점을 맞춰 논리를 전개하고 있습니다. ②번 문장 '이 상대성 원리는 부뿐만 아니라 삶의 다른 많은 영역에도 적용된다'는 논의의 범위를 부에서 다른 영역으로 갑자기 확장시켜, 글의 구체적이고 집중적인 논지에서 벗어납니다. 따라서 전체 흐름과 관계가 없습니다.

reading_comprehension_problems.passage: It is difficult, if not impossible, ① [to define / defining] the limits which reason should impose on the desire for wealth; for there is no absolute or definite amount of wealth which will satisfy a man. The amount is always relative, that is to say, just so much as will maintain the proportion between what he wants and what he gets; for ② [to measure / measuring] a man's happiness only by what he gets... is as pointless as to try and express a fraction. A man never feels the loss of things which it never ③ [occurs / is occurred] to him to ask for; he is just as happy without them.
reading_comprehension_problems.question: 다음 글의 각 네모 안에서 어법에 맞는 표현으로 가장 적절한 것을 각각 고르시오.

answer.explanation: 'It is difficult to...' 구문에서 'It'은 가주어이고, to부정사구 'to define...'이 진주어 역할을 합니다. 따라서 'to define'이 어법에 맞습니다.

동명사구(measuring...)나 to부정사구(to measure...) 둘 다 문장의 주어로 올 수 있지만, 이 문장에서는 to부정사 'to try'와 병렬 구조를 이루며 '...하는 것은 ...하는 것과 같다'는 의미를 형성하므로 'to measure'가 더 자연스럽고 일반적입니다. 동명사 주어도 문법적으로 틀리지는 않으나, to부정사가 주어로 사용될 때 행위의 목적이나 의도를 강조하는 뉘앙스를 가집니다.
동사 'occur'는 '생각이 떠오르다'라는 의미로 사용될 때 자동사이며, 'it occurs to someone that/to do' 형태의 구문으로 쓰입니다. 수동태로 사용되지 않으므로 'occurs'가 맞습니다.
